title: Is Textbook really required for sem1 9+gpa? Or classnotes & ppt enough?

comments.body: You require only mechanics text book, if you are in chem cycle
only ppt is enough for all subject + PESU Notes (9.8 cgpa I have using only this)

Hey, was wondering what you used to do on a daily basis after college and what you did like a week before tests (ISA and ESA's)
What material did you prioritise/refer?

Hey, see I will be real with you. Listen to class proper and chill after college everyday! No need to make notes etc, just listen and understand what they are teaching. 1 week before ISA/ESA start the prep and my priority was always Slides. Be really really good with slides, like go through each page in the slides properly and in depth that's it. I have gotten 10 SGPA only using slides!! One more tip - Study for ISA same as ESA. For example for ISA 1 you will have unit 1 and 2 (Study for ISA like ESA like you are preparing for subjective exam). This makes ESA very easy as you have already covered all 4 units and you have to just revise again. Also i like to keep writing notes/Scribbling my notebook when i read slides (like important points helps me to remember things properly)
I'll definitely keep that in mind. Thanks for the advice!
Wow,may I ask what and all related to cs/programming did you learn in your first year?
so yeah i concentrated more on c and python like mastered these two languages. Other subject just for marks/gpa i studied. I did some web development at home free time (Helped me little)
Don't forget anything from classnotes and ppt. You can borrow the TB from the library if you need it. Just don't get any grade lower than C and You're fine.
What about numericals? What material do we use for them?
slides was enough + pesu notes sometimes
